name: React
description: React is a JavaScript library for building interactive user interfaces, particularly single-page applications. This guide walks you through creating a simple To-Do App in React with best practices for project structure.

snippets.title: Project Directory Structure
snippets.codeDes: A well-organized project structure helps maintain clean and scalable code. Here’s the recommended file structure for your To-Do App.
snippets.code:
todo-app/
│── src/
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── TodoInput.js
│   │   ├── TodoItem.js
│   │   ├── TodoList.js
│   ├── App.js
│   ├── index.js
│── public/
│── package.json
│── README.md

snippets.title: Install Node.js and Create a React App
snippets.codeDes: Before starting, install Node.js from nodejs.org. Then, create a new React project using Create React App, a tool that sets up a modern React environment.
snippets.code:
npx create-react-app todo-app
cd todo-app
npm start

snippets.title: Create a To-Do Component (TodoItem.js)
snippets.codeDes: A functional component that displays individual to-do items. It receives props (text, completed) and applies styles based on completion status.

snippets.title: Manage State with useState Hook (App.js)
snippets.codeDes: The useState hook allows us to manage the list of to-dos dynamically. It provides a state variable and a function to update it.

snippets.title: Create an Input Component (TodoInput.js)
snippets.codeDes: A component that contains an input field and a button. Users can type a task and add it to the list when submitted.

snippets.title: Display the List of To-Dos (TodoList.js)
snippets.codeDes: A component that maps through the list of to-dos and displays each item using the TodoItem component.

snippets.title: Complete To-Do App Code (App.js)
snippets.codeDes: The final App component integrates all the sub-components and manages the application's state.

snippets.title: Run the To-Do App
snippets.codeDes: Start the React development server to see the To-Do App in action.

snippets.title: Best Practices for Project Structure
snippets.code:
1. **Use a components folder**: Keep UI components in `src/components/` for better organization.
2. **Separate logic from presentation**: Maintain state and logic in `App.js` while keeping reusable UI elements in separate components.
3. **Use meaningful file names**: Avoid generic names like `Component.js`, use `TodoInput.js`, `TodoList.js`, etc.
4. **Keep functions reusable**: Functions like `toggleTodo` should be kept modular for reusability.
5. **Keep styling separate**: Use a `styles/` folder or CSS-in-JS solutions like Styled Components.
